com.matrixone.apps.domain.util
Class MapList

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList
              com.matrixone.apps.domain.util.MapList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable, java.util.Collection, java.util.List, java.util.RandomAccess
public class MapList
extends java.util.ArrayList

The MapList class is used to store a list of map objects.

Version:
1.0 - Copyright (c) 2001, MatrixOne, Inc.
See Also:
ArrayList, Serialized Form

 MapList mapList = new MapList();

Constructs an empty list with the specified initial capacity.

Example:
 MapList mapList = new MapList(10);

Parameters:

Constructs an map list with the specified initial list.

Example:
 MapList mapList = new MapList(list);

Parameters:
list - the collection for initializing the MapList
Method Detail

addSortKey

public void addSortKey(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String dir,
                       java.lang.String type)
Defines a sort key for the sort routine.

Example:
 MapList mapList = mxBus.query(...);
 mapList.addSortKey("type", "ascending", "String");
 mapList.addSortKey("name", "descending", "String");
 mapList.sort();

Parameters:
name - The name of the key to sort on.
dir - The direction to sort. Can be "ascending" or "descending". If this is null, then it defaults to "ascending".
type - The type of the key to sort on. This can be "string", "stringpad", "integer", "real", "multilevel" or "date". If this is null, then it defaults to "string".

clearSortKeys

public void clearSortKeys()
Clears all the sort keys so that a new sort can be defined.

Example:
 MapList mapList = mxBus.query(...);
 mapList.addSortKey("type", "ascending", "String");
 mapList.addSortKey("name", "descending", "String");
 mapList.sort();
 mapList.clearSortKeys();
 mapList.addSortKey("name", "ascending", "String");
 mapList.sort();

sort

public void sort()
Sorts the list of maps based on the sort keys specified using the addSortKey method.

Example:
 MapList mapList = mxBus.query(...);
 mapList.addSortKey("type", "ascending", "String");
 mapList.addSortKey("name", "descending", "String");
 mapList.sort();

sort

public void sort(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String dir,
                 java.lang.String type)
Sorts the list of maps based on the given sort key name, direction, and type.

Example:
 MapList mapList = mxBus.query(...);
 mapList.sort("type", "ascending", "String");

Parameters:
name - The name of the key to sort on.
dir - The direction to sort. Can be "ascending" or "descending". If this is null, then it defaults to "ascending".
type - The type of the key to sort on. This can be "string", "stringpad", "integer", "real", "multilevel" or "date". If this is null, then it defaults to "string".

sortStructure

public void sortStructure()
Sorts the list of maps based on the sort keys specified using the addSortKey method while keeping the structure intact.

Example:
 MapList mapList = mxBus.expand(...);
 mapList.addSortKey("type", "ascending", "String");
 mapList.addSortKey("name", "descending", "String");
 mapList.sortStructure();

sortStructure

public MapList sortStructure(Context context,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String dir,
                             java.lang.String comparatorJPO)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Sorts the list of maps based on the given sort key name, direction, and type while keeping the structure intact.

Example:
 MapList mapList = mxBus.expand(...);
 mapList.sortStructure(context, "type", "ascending", comparatorJPO);

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
name - The name of the key to sort on.
dir - The direction to sort. Can be "ascending" or "descending". If this is null, then it defaults to "ascending".
comparatorJPO - name of the comparator JPO to be used to sort.
Returns:
the map list
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the operation fails

sortStructure

public void sortStructure(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String dir,
                          java.lang.String type)
Sorts the list of maps based on the given sort key name, direction, and type while keeping the structure intact.

Example:
 MapList mapList = mxBus.expand(...);
 mapList.sortStructure("type", "ascending", "String");

Parameters:
name - The name of the key to sort on.
dir - The direction to sort. Can be "ascending" or "descending". If this is null, then it defaults to "ascending".
type - The type of the key to sort on. This can be "string", "stringpad", "integer", "real", or "date". If this is null, then it defaults to "string".
